subject: Re: Error CreateProcess error=206 when trying to execute JUnit test from Eclipse
msgSnippet: Hi Thomas, Consider looking into Maven; it will manage your libraries for you. It supports JUnit, through the so-called maven-surefire-plugin. The most recent
messageBody:
Hi Thomas,

Consider looking into Maven; it will manage your libraries for you. It supports JUnit, through the so-called maven-surefire-plugin. The most recent version of said plugin (2.9) includes a bugfix that sounds very relevant to your issue.

At the risk of overloading you with links, have a look at the following:

http://support.microsoft.com/?kbid=830473
http://maven.apache.org/
http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-surefire-plugin/
http://maven.apache.org/plugins/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/class-loading.html

Good luck,
Stephan

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "thomas.adler81" <thomas.adler81@...> wrote:
>
> Hi!
>
> I am trying to execute JUnit tests from Eclipse running on Windows Vista, and I am receiving message:
>
> Cannot run program "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\javaw.exe" (in directory "H:\Users\MyName\workspace\MyProject"):
> CreateProcess error=206, The filename or extension is too long
>
> My project includes lot of jars and so on, and it can be run on Application Server without errors. I searched Google and the found similar error in a bit different context:
> http://netbeans.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=200790
>
> They are saying that run configuration processes the list of libraries and add the result to the classpath but it becomes too long for Windows. So - I guess - this is more the problem of Eclipse "Run As..." plugin and not the JUnit, but btw - maybe someone can suggest how to remove this error.
>
> And, as I am JUnit newbies - can someone suggest how to run JUnit tests outside Eclipse. I guess it can be painfully, because one needs to transfer all the necessary configuration outside Eclipse to this new environment.
>
> Thanks in advance!
>
